adjectives.description: institutionalized (comparative more institutionalized, superlative most institutionalized)

entries.meaning: Having been established as an institution.
examples: It is very difficult to get bureaucracies to abandon their institutionalized practices.

entries.meaning: Having been committed to an institution, such as a prison or an insane asylum.
examples: Once a potential employer learns that you've been institutionalized, you can forget about getting the job.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of institutionalize
